Package algorithms.matrix

Class MatrixUtil.ConditionedMatrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.matrix.MatrixUtil.ConditionedMatrix
  • Enclosing class:
    MatrixUtil
    public static class MatrixUtil.ConditionedMatrix
extends java.lang.Object
    pre- and post- multiply using the diagonal matrices D_1 and D_2, depending upon the problem. example use of a pre-conditioned matrix A: solve equation A_hat * x_hat = b_hat For pre-multiplication: A_hat = D_1 * A * D_2 b_hat = (D_2)^-1 * b x_hat = (D_2)^-1 * x (this isn't done when solving for x in A*x=b) For post-multiplication: x = x_hat * D_2

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      double[][] aHat
      A_hat = D_1 * A * D_2 where D_1 is diagonal(d1) and D_2 is diagonal(d2)
      double[] d1
      This matrix diagonal can be used to pre-condition (pre-multiply) vector b in A*x=b: b_hat = D_1 * b where D_1 is diagonal(d1)
      double[] d2
      This matrix diagonal can be used to post-multiply x_hat in A_hat * x_hat = b_hat.

      Constructors

    • Field Detail

      • aHat

        public double[][] aHat
        A_hat = D_1 * A * D_2 where D_1 is diagonal(d1) and D_2 is diagonal(d2)

      • d1

        public double[] d1
        This matrix diagonal can be used to pre-condition (pre-multiply) vector b in A*x=b: b_hat = D_1 * b where D_1 is diagonal(d1)

      • d2

        public double[] d2
        This matrix diagonal can be used to post-multiply x_hat in A_hat * x_hat = b_hat. x = x_hat * D_2 where D_w is diagonal(d2)
